waffleoRai_Utils

Class CompositeBuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • waffleoRai_Utils.FileBuffer
      • waffleoRai_Utils.ROSubFileBuffer
        • waffleoRai_Utils.CompositeBuffer

  • public class CompositeBuffer
extends ROSubFileBuffer
    A FileBuffer subclass that is composed of a set of sequential references to other file buffers.
    Since:
    February 13, 2018
    Version:
    1.0.2
    Author:
    Blythe Hospelhorn

    • Constructor Detail

      • CompositeBuffer

        public CompositeBuffer(int initBufferNumber)
        Construct CompositeBuffer with internal ArrayList of provided size. Recommended for when the number of buffers composing it is known (ie. file serialization) Super-superclass is constructed empty with only a child list.
        Parameters:
        initBufferNumber - Initial size of internal ArrayList.

      • CompositeBuffer

        public CompositeBuffer()
        Construct CompositeBuffer that utilizes a LinkedList internally. Better for composites that will add and access buffer pieces sequentially.

        Overrides:

        Parameters:
        inMem - : Collection (eg. List) of FileBuffer references already counted
        Returns:
        Composite memory burden of all referenced buffers, if not referenced in input list.

      • getMinimumMemoryUsage

        public long getMinimumMemoryUsage()
        Description copied from class: FileBuffer
        Approximate the memory usage, in bytes, of this buffer. This number is a considered a minimum possible value. It only counts the size of all instance variables and objects supposedly unique to this instance. It does not count the potential size of any methods or method pointers. Note that the FileBuffer class contains a lot of methods, and it is quite possible that this alone may increase memory usage.
        Also note that some estimates for the size of unique internally referenced objects may also come in a bit low. This calculation compounds that underestimation.
        The object may, in reality, take up more memory than this indicates. Obtaining a more accurate value from the JVM is somewhat difficult, and may not be necessary.

        IMPORTANT: This function only returns the memory usage for this instance. If this FileBuffer is a readonly buffer that references points in other buffers, but does not contain a byte array or structure itself, the value will NOT include the backing data; only the approximate size the pointers used to reference the parent might be. If the backing buffer is lost or unknown, it might be more prudent to call the ROSubFileBuffer class's getMemoryBurden method!
        Overrides:
        getMinimumMemoryUsage in class ROSubFileBuffer
        Returns:
        A size representing the minimum size, in bytes, that this instance likely uses in memory.

      • addToFile

        public void addToFile(FileBuffer addition,
                      int insertPos,
                      int stPos,
                      int edPos)
        Insert a new buffer into the composite buffer at a position other than the end. If inserted into the middle of an existing buffer, will split buffer into two read-only pieces.
        Overrides:
        addToFile in class FileBuffer
        Parameters:
        addition - The FileBuffer to add
        insertPos - The index of this at which addition will be inserted.
        stPos - The first byte of addition to add.
        edPos - The final byte (exclusive) of addition to add.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If any provided index is invalid.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the given FileBuffer to add is null or empty.

      • setBufferedWrite

        public void setBufferedWrite()
        Switch write mode (to disk) to buffered write. Buffered writing utilizes two byte array buffers to write to disk - filling one in a second thread while writing the other out.

      • setAppendedWrite

        public void setAppendedWrite()
        Switch write mode (for disk writing) to appending write. When set to appending write, each component buffer is appended to the end of the file at the target path using its append function.

      • setWriteBufferSize

        public void setWriteBufferSize(int memory)
        Set total buffer size of the write buffer, if in use.
        Parameters:
        memory - Maximum amount, in bytes, of memory that this object can use as buffer space to write to disk.

      • writeFile

        public void writeFile(java.lang.String path,
                      long stPos,
                      long edPos)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from class: FileBuffer
        Write a file to disk using the path string provided. Will fail if path is invalid. Will create any directories specified in path that do not currently exist.
        Overrides:
        writeFile in class ROSubFileBuffer
        Parameters:
        path - Path of file to write object to.
        stPos - Position within buffer of first byte to write (inclusive)
        edPos - Position within buffer of first byte to not write (exclusive)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If any provided position is invalid.
        java.lang.IllegalThreadStateException - If there is a thread interruption when buffer filling thread tries to join main thread. This is only possible for buffered writes.
        java.io.IOException - If path is invalid or file could not be written.

      • createCopy

        public FileBuffer createCopy(int stPos,
                             int edPos)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from class: FileBuffer
        Create a new copy of the file buffer. This creates a fresh copy - it does not reference the existing file buffer. It should thus be noted that consumption of memory will increase accordingly.
        Overrides:
        createCopy in class ROSubFileBuffer
        Parameters:
        stPos - Starting position of copy procedure (inclusive)
        edPos - Ending position of copy procedure (exclusive)
        Returns:
        New FileBuffer whose contents are identical to this one.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If one or more the positions provided is invalid.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If this buffer's content list is null.
        java.io.IOException - If copying requires disk access and disk access failed for any reason.
